colors.name: color-text
colors.description: Default text color. Used as the main text color throughout the UI. Provides good and legible contrast for our content.

colors.name: color-text-mid
colors.description: Mid text color. Used for e.g. introduction paragraphs and help texts that are coupled with form elements.

colors.name: color-text-softer
colors.description: Softer text color. Used for e.g. disabled buttons, footers, table headings, captions and placeholder texts.

colors.name: color-text-link
colors.description: Default link text color. Used for all paragraph level links in an user interface.

colors.name: color-background
colors.description: Default application background color. Should be set to either html or body element.

colors.name: color-surface
colors.description: Default application surface color. Use this for e.g. card backgrounds.

colors.name: color-surface-raised
colors.description: Default raised surface color. Use this when you need to separate a specific layer from the surface color, e.g. table headers.

colors.name: color-stroke-strong
colors.description: Strong stroke color for highlighting specific parts in the user interface.

colors.name: color-primary-fill-*
colors.description: Fill colors (softer, soft, mid, loud, louder). Used for backgrounds and surfaces. Automatically adapt between light and dark modes.
colors.light: Uses accent-seed with varying contrast against background
colors.dark: Uses accent-seed with varying contrast against background

colors.name: color-primary-stroke-*
colors.description: Stroke colors (softer, soft, mid). Used for borders and outlines. By design, strokes have no loud variants.

colors.name: color-primary-text-on-*
colors.description: Text-on colors (soft, mid, loud). Provide adequate contrast on fill colors. Soft works on soft/softer fills, loud works on loud/louder fills.
colors.light: Uses accent-seed mixed with soft tint for legibility
colors.dark: Uses accent-seed mixed with soft tint for legibility
